page.title: 17News Item,(cont.)
page.content: "Mr.Monk then contacted the Police.Simmond saw a car entering the pub car-park a few minutes later and dashed outside to ask for a ride. The plain-clothes officers in the car were happy to oblige and drove him straight back to the prison. A second prisoner tried to escape with Simmonds but sprained his ankle before he reached the security fence. A spokesman for the Home Office said Simmond escaped by scaling the security fence,running acrosswaste ground and climbing over a contractor's gate. Simmond,from Barking,Essex,was sentenced to 15 months last year for entering a building as a tresspasser,for three charges of theft and one of deception."
